algorithm_technique: Greedy approach using hashmaps to track counts of subsequences ending at a number.
Iterate through the array, extending existing subsequences or starting new ones.
problem_summary_simple: Split an array into consecutive subsequences of length at least 3.
problem_summary_technical: Greedily extend existing subsequences or start new ones, using hashmaps to track counts of subsequences ending at each number.
key_insights: The greedy strategy is to extend the shortest possible valid subsequence first.
Two hashmaps are used: one for the count of numbers and one for subsequences ending at a number.
Prioritize appending to existing subsequences of length >= 2 before starting new ones.
